result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daryl S. Brandt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Motion Hrg held on 10/16/2014 before Judge Jacobson. 
Includes 13CF790 and 14CF268

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:34 am 
INCLUDES 13CF790 AND 14CF268. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person with Atty Dennis Melowski.   
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to:
In 13CF790: Ct. 1 (OWI 3rd)>>DISMISS. 
In 14CF268: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: In 13CF790: Ct. 2 (Operating with PAC 3rd)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Atty Melowski makes statement. Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: $1690 inclusive and DNA surcharge with 60 days to pay or payment plan; 90 days MCJ to begin immediately with huber if def qualifies under jail criteria; Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 26 months, as is the defendant himself; 26 month dl revocation with administrative credit; AODA. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 1 day jail credit. 
COURT remits DNA charge. 

Adj: 10:52 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety. Continue Day report program through Attic.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:22 am 
INCLUDES 13CF790 AND 14CF268. 
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher; Deft appears in person with Atty Dennis Melowski. 

INITIAL APPEARANCE IN 14CF268. 
Reading Waived. 
COURT ORDERS $1000 signature bond - CONDITIONS: continue day report as required in 13CF790 and absolute sobriety. 
Preliminary Hearing Time Limits are waived. 
COURT advises parties to see JA to set preliminary hearing in this matter. 

MOTION HEARING IN 13CF790. 
Date and time set for hearing on deft's motion to exclude deft's prior OWI conviction. 
Argument. 
D.B. sworn and testifies. 
Argument. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT grants motion. 

Adj: 10:11 am
Motion hearing on October 16, 2014 at 09:15 am.
Motion hearing on July 22, 2014 at 3:30 pm
and Order to Quash Arrest Warrant
Defendant did not appear for initial appearance.
